title.rendered: Can I crash my SSD if I use CCleaner to clean Windows?

content.rendered:
The maintenance and optimization of the Microsoft operating system, Windows, is key to being able to get the most out of this software. These are tasks that we can carry out manually, or use specific programs as is the case with CCleaner.

The truth is that, to clean useless content in this system, it is almost essential to have advanced knowledge of it. In addition, we must have patience and time to be able to locate all those useless files and folders. This is information that is part of our drives and that slows down Windows as well as wasting disk space. But if we want to largely automate these types of tasks and improve the smoothness of system operation, we have some software at our disposal.

Here we can find both paid and free solutions that will help us optimize and clean Microsoft software. To a large extent, everything will depend on the needs of each case and the willingness to pay for a commercial program. One of the most representative that we find in this sector is the aforementioned CCleaner. Despite the fact that it has sometimes been involved in some controversy, this application is widespread throughout the world. It offers us a multitude of functions focused on these tasks that we are commenting on and that they intend improve the performance of Windows.

As you can imagine, a good part of how this program works is focused on the tasks it carries out with our disk drives. You have to access them in depth in search of useless content and to perform multiple scans and analyses. All in order to optimize the system and eliminate information that is useless to us.

CCleaner compatibility with SSD drives

Precisely because of all this and because of certain controversies that have arisen with this program, some users are suspicious of this particular software. In fact, over the last few months some issues related to the work of CCleaner with Windows have been seen in computers with SSD drives installed. Specifically, there are users who doubt whether these solid drives could be damaged if they run this program with them.

So much so that the software developer firm itself has been obliged to clarify this aspect for all those who have doubts. In the event that you have drives with these characteristics in your computers, which by the way are becoming more and more common, you do not have to fear for the health of these SSDs. As we are informed by the heads of this windows optimization programthe application is designed so that work without problem on desktops and laptops equipped with solid state drives.

Therefore, we will be able to benefit from most of its optimization and cleaning functions without any fear. Of course, they also tell us about some exceptions in this regard. Specifically, they tell us that there are certain functions that we should not use on SSD drives. As we are told, they do not recommend using CCleaner’s functions that perform safe overwrite tasks. Here they refer to the features related to secure content deletion. In addition, this is something that is extended both to this program and to the rest that carry out these tasks.
